user_question: How can I capture the Milky Way in a photograph, and can you generate an image of a starry night sky?
final_answer: To capture the Milky Way, use a wide-angle lens, set the ISO to 3200, aperture to f/2.8, and shutter speed to 20 seconds. Image of a starry night sky generated. The best time to photograph the Milky Way is from April to September.
